item.title: “I really appreciate the governor’s framing of equality and...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“I really appreciate the governor’s framing of equality and justice as a framework for the entire State of the State. We have to have that lens on everything that we do.”
- State Representative Leslie Herod

item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "The movement for Black lives has been happening for...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The movement for Black lives has been happening for generations. It didn’t just pop up this summer and it’s not something that ended this past summer either. We will continue to fight for change, but we want to make sure that change is implemented in a way that is just and fair." - State Representative Leslie Herod

Denver7

The Civil Rights Movement of the 1960s often takes center stage when the nation reflects on the fight for equality in America. But in Colorado, civil rights victories came nearly 100 years before that 1960s movement.

thedenverchannel.com

Black Coloradans' fight for civil rights began a century before the national movement

The Civil Rights Movement of the 1960s often takes center stage when the nation reflects on the fight for equality in America. But in Colorado, civil rights victories came nearly 100 years before that 1960s movement.The Civil Rights Movement of the 1960s often takes center stage when the nation reflects on the fight for equality in America. But in Colorado, civil rights victories came nearly 100 years before that 1960s movement.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "What we're seeing about the use of ketamine in the...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"What we're seeing about the use of ketamine in the field is that they are not utilizing the appropriate medical protocols before administering the drug and that is why we're seeing the adverse effects and that is what needs to stop." - State Representative Leslie Herod

Rep. Leslie Herod’s bill is a response to the death of Elijah McClain and comes after KUNC revealed more than 900 ketamine sedations for excited or agitated people around the state in 2.5 years.

kunc.org

Colorado Lawmaker Will Give Peers Choice To Either Ban Or Rein In Ketamine Sedations

Rep. Leslie Herod’s bill is a response to the death of Elijah McClain and comes after KUNC revealed more than 900 ketamine sedations for excited or agitated people around the state in 2.5 years.Rep. Leslie Herod’s bill is a response to the death of Elijah McClain and comes after KUNC revealed more than 900 ketamine sedations for excited or agitated people around the state in 2.5 years.

Join the members of the Colorado Black Caucus for a Black History Month Town Hall TOMMOROW, Saturday, February 20th at 12PM!

The town hall will be live streamed, here, on the Colorado Black Caucus’ Facebook page. See you soon!
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "I'm proud to say that the governor opened his speech...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"I'm proud to say that the governor opened his speech talking about equity and equality. Then the governor really framed all of his conversation around that, and I think that was so very important." - State Representative Leslie Herod

item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "In about a week, a Coloradan was able to use his computer...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"In about a week, a Coloradan was able to use his computer skills for the greater good by creating a tool to help everyone find COVID-19 vaccine appointments across the state."

Denver7

After hearing frustrations from colleagues, Nick Muerdter, a computer programmer, decided to create a website to help Coloradans locate vaccine appointments across the state.

thedenverchannel.com

Coloradan creates website to help find COVID-19 vaccine appointments

After hearing frustrations from colleagues, Nick Muerdter, a computer programmer, decided to create a website to help Coloradans locate vaccine appointments across the state.After hearing frustrations from colleagues, Nick Muerdter, a computer programmer, decided to create a website to help Coloradans locate vaccine appointments across the state.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "Among the most important pieces of that new policy is a...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Among the most important pieces of that new policy is a non-binding goal that 35 percent of all housing units built on RTD property be affordable. The new policy would also give RTD staff more flexibility to allow housing developments that don’t include a garage to replace every parking spot they use."

Colorado Public Radio

The RTD board will soon vote on a new policy designed to encourage more housing to be built on the agency’s property near its stations — mostly park and rides — across metro Denver.

cpr.org

RTD Wants More Housing Near Stations. It May Sacrifice Unused Parking Spots To Make That Happen

The RTD board will soon vote on a new policy designed to encourage more housing to be built on the agency’s property near its stations — mostly park and rides — across metro Denver.The RTD board will soon vote on a new policy designed to encourage more housing to be built on the agency’s property near its stations — mostly park and rides — across metro Denver.

item.title: “I’ve always said that Joe could run the world. People just...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“I’ve always said that Joe could run the world. People just need to know who he is."- State Representative Leslie Herod

Eli Stokols of the L.A. Times

Second-term Colorado Rep. Joe Neguse, 36, drew bipartisan praise in his role as an impeachment manager, sparking talk about his future.

latimes.com

Rep. Joe Neguse, Democrats' youngest impeachment manager, emerges as next-gen star

Second-term Colorado Rep. Joe Neguse, 36, drew bipartisan praise in his role as an impeachment manager, sparking talk about his future.Second-term Colorado Rep. Joe Neguse, 36, drew bipartisan praise in his role as an impeachment manager, sparking talk about his future.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "It’s imperative that we address Coloradans concerns...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"It’s imperative that we address Coloradans concerns around COVID and COVID recovery. So, what does that mean? It means that we have to get to work to stimulate the economy."

Denver7

Tuesday marked the first day of the second start to the 2021 legislative session at the Colorado state capitol.

Colorado lawmakers get right to work on the grand reopening of the 2021 legislative session

item.title: "Massachusetts ended a mandate requiring cops in schools....
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Massachusetts ended a mandate requiring cops in schools. Now advocates want Maryland and Florida, the remaining states with such laws, to follow suit and break the school-to-prison pipeline."

The Appeal

Massachusetts ended a mandate requiring cops in schools. Now advocates want Maryland and Florida, the remaining states with such laws, to follow suit.

theappeal.org

New Massachusetts Law Paves the Way for Police-Free Schools

Massachusetts ended a mandate requiring cops in schools. Now advocates want Maryland and Florida, the remaining states with such laws, to follow suit.Massachusetts ended a mandate requiring cops in schools. Now advocates want Maryland and Florida, the remaining states with such laws, to follow suit.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "Gov. Jared Polis will deliver his annual State of the...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Gov. Jared Polis will deliver his annual State of the State address on Wednesday, Feb. 17 at the Colorado Capitol. It's a significant moment for the governor to put his mark on the beginning of the annual legislative session, as well as reflect back on a year unlike any in living history."

Colorado Public Radio

Polis is expected to use the speech to outline his policy priorities and goals for the upcoming months, touching on everything from pandemic stimulus spending to education and transportation reforms.

cpr.org

Almost A Year Into The Pandemic, Polis Will Tell The State Where He Hopes To Go From Here

Polis is expected to use the speech to outline his policy priorities and goals for the upcoming months, touching on everything from pandemic stimulus spending to education and transportation reforms.Polis is expected to use the speech to outline his policy priorities and goals for the upcoming months, touching on everything from pandemic stimulus spending to education and transportation reforms.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "One of America’s most populous counties is piloting an...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"One of America’s most populous counties is piloting an income guarantee to young adults who age out of the foster care system, providing much-needed support for vulnerable youth transitioning into adulthood. Other cities and counties should follow Santa Clara County’s lead."

The Appeal

One of America’s most populous counties is providing an income guarantee to young adults who age out of the foster care system, providing much-needed support for vulnerable youth transitioning into adulthood. Other cities and counties should follow Santa Clara County’s lead.

theappeal.org

Give Kids Aging Out of the Foster Care System Money To Survive

One of America’s most populous counties is providing an income guarantee to young adults who age out of the foster care system, providing much-needed support for vulnerable youth transitioning into adulthood. Other cities and counties should follow Santa Clara County’s lead.One of America’s most populous counties is providing an income guarantee to young adults who age out of the foster care system, providing much-needed support for vulnerable youth transitioning into adulthood. Other cities and counties should follow Santa Clara County’s lead.

Lawmakers will begin to review the more than 600 bills expected in the next 117 days.

item.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...
